note.p: Birth: Teignmouth, Devon, England (26 December 1791)
Death: London (18 October 1871)
Profession: Mathematician
Research Field: Mathematics, computer logic, computer technology
Education: Holmwood School, Ponder's End (with Frederick Marryat (FRS 1819)); entered Trinity College, Cambridge (1811), but graduated from Peterhouse, Cambridge. BA (1814), MA (1817)
Career: Lucasian Professor of Mathematics, Cambridge (1828-1839); developed calculating machine using his own money and government grants; involved in actuarial work
Memberships: Statistical Society (Founder Fellow 1834); FRAS
Membership: Fellow
Election Date: 14/03/1816
